intro: Bewsia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered bewsia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in pairs, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Bewsia biflora is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in dry, arid environments.
